name: Jimeng Sun 0001
content: Sunlab - AI for Healthcare ResearchDr. Jimeng SunHealth Innovation ProfessorUniversity of Illinois Urbana-ChampaignDr. Jimeng Sun is a Health Innovation Professor at the Siebel School of Computing and Data Science and Carle Illinois College of Medicine at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, where he leads groundbreaking research at the intersection of artificial intelligence and healthcare. As co-founder of Keiji AI, he is pioneering the transformation of clinical trials through advanced AI optimization and predictive modeling, accelerating drug development and improving trial success rates.Research Excellence & ImpactDr. Sun's research portfolio spans the full spectrum of AI-driven healthcare innovation, from clinical AI systems and drug discovery to AI for clinical trials and machine learning for biosignals. His work has produced transformative advances in:Clinical AI Systems & Healthcare Analytics: Developing interpretable models like RETAIN for healthcare prediction, building sophisticated patient similarity measures, temporal clinical event prediction models, and designing AI systems for medication recommendation and clinical outcome prediction that are actively deployed in healthcare settingsDrug Discovery & Development: Creating novel molecular optimization frameworks, drug-target interaction prediction models, and AI-driven therapeutic discovery platforms including the acclaimed Therapeutics Data CommonsAI for Clinical Trials: Pioneering patient-trial matching systems, clinical trial outcome prediction models, and optimization frameworks for trial design and patient recruitment through advanced deep learning and graph neural networksMachine Learning for Biosignals: Advancing expert-level sleep staging with deep neural networks, creating automated seizure classification systems, and developing AI models for EEG interpretation and cardiac monitoring from physiological data streamsWith over 40,000 citations and an h-index of 101, Dr. Sun has authored more than 500 publications in top-tier venues including Nature, NEJM AI, and leading AI conferences. His research has been recognized with prestigious awards and has directly influenced clinical practice through collaborations with major healthcare institutions.Industry CollaborationNamed one of the Top 100 AI Leaders in Drug Discovery and Advanced Healthcare, Dr. Sun bridges academic research with real-world healthcare applications. Through Keiji AI and partnerships with industry leaders including IQVIA, Medidata, and GE Healthcare, his innovations are transforming how clinical trials are designed, conducted, and analyzed.His collaborative network spans premier healthcare institutions including Massachusetts General Hospital, Beth Israel Deaconess, Northwestern, Vanderbilt, and OSF Healthcare, ensuring his research addresses the most pressing challenges in modern medicine.Academic BackgroundDr. Sun received his B.S. and M.Phil. in Computer Science from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology and his Ph.D. from Carnegie Mellon University.View PublicationsResearch InterestsKeiji AIAcademic & Professional ProfilesGoogle ScholarDBLPPubMedLinkedInX/TwitterJoin Sunlab: Where AI Meets Real-World Healthcare ImpactAt Sunlab, we're not just publishing papersâ€”we're building real-world AI systems that improve healthcare. Led by Prof. Jimeng Sun, we work on cutting-edge topics like clinical foundation models, interpretable ML, and generative AI for medicine. You'll get to collaborate with top hospitals, industry leaders, and an ambitious team pushing the boundaries of what's possible in AI for health.If you want your research to matterâ€”not just in theory, but in practiceâ€”Sunlab is the place to be.For Prospective CS StudentsInterested in applying AI to healthcare? Join Sunlab to work on cutting-edge research at the intersection of machine learning and medicine. To get started, check out PyHealthâ€”our open-source framework for healthcare MLâ€”and contribute a pull request. Then reach out to me to discuss further opportunities!Explore PyHealthFor Industry CollaboratorsWe welcome collaborations with hospitals, pharma, and healthtech companies. At Sunlab, we have a strong track record of delivering robust models, scalable software, and high-impact publications through joint projects. Feel free to contact me directly to explore partnership opportunities.Contact usFor Medical students, Residents and FellowsSunlab is looking for motivated clinicians with coding skills (Python or R), basic machine learning knowledge, and at least two months of dedicated time to work on impactful research projects in predictive modeling and generative AI. This is a great opportunity to build technical skills, contribute to publications, and stand out in academic medicine or digital health. If interested, please email me your CV and code samples.Contact usLearn about AI in Health!Our AI for Health webinar series brings together cutting-edge research, real-world applications, and thought leaders from academia and industry to explore how AI is transforming healthcare. Whether you're a student passionate about impact-driven innovation or a collaborator from pharma, hospitals, or tech, this series is your gateway to the latest in predictive modeling, clinical decision support, and beyond.ðŸ”¬ Explore Future WebinarsCheck out our upcoming webinar schedule and topicsView ScheduleðŸ“¬ Get NotifiedJoin our mailing list for webinar updates and announcementsJoin Mailing ListðŸ“º Catch Up on Past TalksWatch previous webinars on our YouTube channelYouTube ChannelBe part of the conversation shaping the future of AI in medicine.PublicationsView Dr. Sun's research publications, conference papers, and journal articles.Browse PublicationsResearch TeamMeet the graduate students, researchers, and collaborators in our lab.Meet the TeamSoftwareExplore PyHealth, our comprehensive Python library for healthcare predictive modeling.View Software
